item.title: Got this working on github pages!
item.description: Well, this was a pain in the butt. I didn’t feel like messing with github actions again, as I hate that thing with a passion. So I was looking through the hexo docs and I found a usefull one-command deploy option. All you have to do is add this little tidbit to your _config.yaml. deploy: type: git repo: https://github.com/<username>/<project> # example, https://github.com/l3gacyb3ta/l3gacyb3ta.github.io branch: <whatever branch you use> You also have to install hexo-deployer-git, which is simple, just use this:
